description: Manage Azure NetApp Files (ANF) Subvolume Resources.

commands.name: az netappfiles subvolume create
commands.summary: Create a subvolume in the path or clones the subvolume mentioned in the parentPath.
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles subvolume create --account-name
                                --name
                                --pool-name
                                --resource-group
                                --volume-name
                                [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                [--parent-path]
                                [--path]
                                [--size]
examples: az netappfiles subvolume create -g mygroup --account-name myaccountname  --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolumename --subvolume-name mysubvolumename

commands.name: az netappfiles subvolume delete
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles subvolume delete [--account-name]
                                [--ids]
                                [--name]
                                [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                [--pool-name]
                                [--resource-group]
                                [--subscription]
                                [--volume-name]
                                [--yes]
examples: az netappfiles subvolume delete -g mygroup --account-name myaccountname  --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolumename --subvolume-name mysubvolumename

commands.name: az netappfiles subvolume list
commands.summary: List a list of the subvolumes in the volume.
examples: az netappfiles subvolume list -g mygroup --account-name myaccountname  --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolumename

commands.name: az netappfiles subvolume show
commands.summary: Get the path associated with the subvolumeName provided.
examples: az netappfiles subvolume show -g mygroup --account-name myaccountname  --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolumename --subvolume-name mysubvolumename

commands.name: az netappfiles subvolume update
commands.summary: Update a subvolume in the path or clones the subvolume mentioned in the parentPath.
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles subvolume update [--account-name]
                                [--add]
                                [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                [--ids]
                                [--name]
                                [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                [--parent-path]
                                [--path]
                                [--pool-name]
                                [--remove]
                                [--resource-group]
                                [--set]
                                [--size]
                                [--subscription]
                                [--volume-name]
examples: az netappfiles subvolume update -g mygroup --account-name myaccountname  --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolumename --subvolume-name mysubvolumename

commands.name: az netappfiles subvolume wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
